name: Wellness Program
description: Project Open Hand's Wellness Program serves critically ill residents of San Francisco with an eligible primary diagnosis by providing the following free nutrition services: - Medically-tailored meals - Fresh groceries (mobile option available) - Nutrition counseling and education
fullDescription: Project Open Hand's Wellness Program serves critically ill residents of San Francisco with an eligible primary diagnosis by providing the following free nutrition services: - Medically-tailored meals - Fresh groceries (mobile option available) - Nutrition counseling and education
whatTheyOffer: Project Open Hand's Wellness Program serves critically ill residents of San Francisco with an eligible primary diagnosis by providing the following free nutrition services: - Medically-tailored meals - Fresh groceries (mobile option available) - Nutrition counseling and education
howToGetIt: - If you have a Wellness Program eligible diagnosis, complete one of the application forms with your licensed medical provider or registered dietitian: - San Francisco County application form - San Francisco Health Plan Application Form - Submit the form by email, fax, mail or in-person. - If you have questions, call Client Services at (415) 447-2326.
